{{Infobox organization |name = International Association for Accounting Education & Research |bgcolor = |fgcolor = |image = IAAER logo.jpg |image_border = |size = 200px |alt = |caption = |map = |msize = |malt = |mcaption = |abbreviation = |motto = |formation = 1984 |extinction = |type = Professional association |status = |purpose = Support accountancy education and research |headquarters = |location = |region_served = Worldwide |membership = |language = English |leader_title = President |leader_name = Prof Gary Sundem |main_organ = |parent_organization = |affiliations = International Federation of Accountants(IFAC) |num_staff = |num_volunteers = |budget = |website = http://www.iaaer.org/ |remarks = }} The '''International Association for Accounting Education & Research''' (IAAER) is a non-profit organization that promotes excellence in accounting education and [[accounting research|research]]. The organization also seeks to ensure that accounting academics make the maximum contribution to development of excellent accounting standards.<ref name=IAAERabout/>
==Foundation==
The origins of the IAAER can be traced back to meetings of the International Congresses on Accounting that started in 1904. The [[International Federation of Accountants]] began holding separate International Conferences on Accounting Education in 1962. IAAER was founded in 1984 to serve as a co-host with the Japanese Accounting Association for the sixth of these conferences, which was scheduled to be held in [[Kyoto]], [[Japan]] in 1987. Its organization was defined at a meeting in [[Toronto]], [[Canada]] on 17 August 1984, with representatives from Australia, Canada, Japan, Netherlands, Germany, the United States and the United Kingdom.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.iaaer.org/about/files/History.pdf |title=A History of the International Association for Accounting Education and Research (IAAER): 1984-2004 |publisher=The Academy of Accounting Historians |author1=Belverd E. Needles, Jr. |author2=Lisa Olmsted |date=August 3, 2004 |accessdate=2011-06-06}}</ref>
==Membership==
IAAER offers institutional, university, individual, and student memberships. As of 2009, IAAER had about 50 institutional members, including professional accounting bodies such as the [[American Institute of Certified Public Accountants]] and accounting academic organizations such as the [[American Accounting Association]]. In 2009, IAAER announced that all members would have access to eIFRS, an online repository of material about [[International Financial Reporting Standards]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.iasplus.com/resource/0802iaaer.pdf |title=IAAER Announces Free eIFRS Access for Academic Members |publisher=Deloitte Global Services Limited |accessdate=2011-06-06}}</ref>
==Activities==
IAAER contributes to international accounting and auditing standards through relationships with various international bodies, bringing a research-based academic viewpoint. Specifically, IAAER is represented on the [[International Accounting Education Standards Board]] (IAESB) of the [[International Federation of Accountants]] (IFAC), the Education Advisory Group of the International Accounting Standards Committee Foundation and the Standards Advisory Council of the [[International Accounting Standards Board]] (IASB).<ref name=IAAERabout/>
IAAER commissions research projects to develop improvements to international accounting and educational standards, and promotes development of accounting skills by working with local and regional bodies and organizing conferences and workshops.<ref name=IAAERabout/> For example, in 2006 IAAER and [[KPMG]] invited research proposals under the Defining, Recognizing and Measuring Liabilities Research Program.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.caaa.ca/_files/file.php?fileid=fileWLnmGCHnBc&filename=file_IAAER_KPMG_Call_for_Proposals.pdf |title=CALL FOR PROPOSALS Research on Defining, Recognizing and Measuring Liabilities IAAER - KPMG Research Opportunities |publisher=Canadian Academic Accounting Association |accessdate=2011-06-06}}</ref> In November 2007, IAAER and the [[Association of Chartered Certified Accountants]] (ACCA) announced that they were providing up to five research grants of up to $25,000, funded by ACCA, to support the work of the IAESB.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www2.accaglobal.com/allnews/global/2007/NEWSQ4/News/3031191 |publisher=ACCA |title=ACCA AND IAAER LAUNCH INTERNATIONAL EDUCATION RESEARCH CALL |date=7 Nov 2007 |accessdate=2011-06-06}}</ref> In July 2010 IAAER and ACCA again issued a call for proposals for research supporting development of international standards of education.<ref>{{cite journal |url=http://www.vrl-financial-news.com/accounting/the-accountant/issues/ta-2010/ta-6080/acca-and-iaaer-call-for-resear.aspx |journal=The Accountant |date=2 July 2010 |title=ACCA and IAAER call for research proposals |accessdate=2011-06-06}}</ref>
The IAAER sponsors and coordinates the World Congress of Accounting Educators and Researchers, which is held every four years in conjunction with IFAC World Congress. IAAER issues the COSMOS Accountancy Chronicle, a newsletter, supports the ''[[Journal of International Financial Management and Accounting]]'' and ''Accounting and Accounting Education: An International Journal'', the official journals of the organization.<ref name=IAAERabout/>
==References== {{reflist |refs= <ref name=IAAERabout>{{cite web |url=http://www.iaaer.org/about/ |publisher=IAAER |title=Mission & Activity Statement |accessdate=2011-06-06}}</ref> }}

{{EngvarB|date=September 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2014}} [[File:Jack thinker.jpg|thumb|Jack Sim pictured as if thinking on a toilet - to raise attention for the importance of [[toilets]].]] '''Jack Sim''' ({{zh|s={{linktext|沈|锐|华}}|t={{linktext|沈|銳|華}}|p=Shěn Ruìhuá}}) is the founder of the [[Restroom Association]] of Singapore, the [[World Toilet Organization]], the [[World Toilet Day]] initiative and [[Bottom of the Pyramid]] (BoP) Hub. Formerly from the [[construction industry]], he decided to devote the rest of his life to social work after attaining financial independence at the age of 40.
In 2001, for "creating good will and bringing the subject into the open" and "mobilizing national support in providing on-the-ground expertise" he received the [[Schwab Foundation]] award for Social Entrepreneur of the Year.<ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=http://www.schwabfound.org/content/jack-sim|title=Jack Sim {{!}} Schwab Foundation for Social Entrepreneurship|website=www.schwabfound.org|language=en|access-date=2017-04-05|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180301120549/http://www.schwabfound.org/content/jack-sim|archive-date=1 March 2018|dead-url=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref> In 2007, Jack was elected a Fellow of [[Ashoka: Innovators for the Public]], and also became one of the key members to convene the [[Sustainable Sanitation Alliance]] which is composed of key players in the [[sanitation]] space.
Jack was named one of the [[Heroes of the Environment (2008)|Heroes of the Environment]] for 2008 by ''[[Time (magazine)|Time]]'' magazine.<ref name="Time">{{cite news|url=http://www.time.com/time/specials/packages/article/0,28804,1841778_1841781_1841822,00.html|title=Jack Sim|last=Beech|first=Hannah|work=Time|accessdate=31 October 2009|date=24 September 2008|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090501144846/http://www.time.com/time/specials/packages/article/0,28804,1841778_1841781_1841822,00.html|archive-date=1 May 2009|dead-url=no|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
He also founded the BOP HUB and a series of social businesses and startups. He is now constructing a 65,000 sq ft World Trade Center for the Poor in Singapore to coordinate and transform the 4 billions poor into a massively efficient marketplace to end global poverty.
== Achievements in sanitation ==
=== Restroom Association === He established the [[Restroom Association]] of Singapore (RAS) in 1998, which addresses the state of dirty public toilets in designs, building codes and poorly trained cleaners.
=== World Toilet Organization === {{Main article|World Toilet Organization}}
Realising the need for a global body on the subject, Jack created the [[World Toilet Organization]] (WTO) in 2001 as a global network and service platform for toilet associations, academia, government, UN agencies and toilet stakeholders to learn from one another and leverage media and corporate support that in turn influenced governments to promote sound sanitation and public health policies.
Since its inception, WTO organized 17 [[World Toilet Organization#World Toilet Summit|World Toilet Summits]] and two World Toilet Expo and Forum straddling Singapore, Seoul, Taipei, Beijing, Belfast, Moscow, New Delhi, Macau, Shanghai, Bangkok, Philadelphia, Durban (South Africa), Hainan China, Solo Indonesia, Kuching Malaysia, Melbourne, Mumbai .
It supports Prime Minister Modi's Swachh Bharat Mission in implementing 110 millions toilets in India and President Xi China Toilet Revolution in Tourism Toilets and Rural Toilets. WTO also build 13 blocks of Rainbow Schools Toilets in rural China.
=== World Toilet Day === {{Main article|World Toilet Day}} World Toilet Organization declared its founding day 19 November in 2001, as [[World Toilet Day]] and this is now celebrated worldwide each year towards improving the state of toilets and sanitation globally. In 2013, all 193 countries of the UN General Assembly unanimously adopted 19 November as the official UN World Toilet Day.

'''James Hamilton''' (1769–1829) was an Irish language teacher, who introduced the "Hamiltonian system" of teaching languages.
==Life== Hamilton was taught for four years at a [[Dublin]] school run by two [[Jesuits]], Beatty and Mulhall. He went into business, and for about three years before the [[French Revolution]] was living in France.<ref name="DNB">{{cite DNB|wstitle=Hamilton, James (1769-1829)|volume=24}}</ref>
In 1798 Hamilton was established as a merchant in [[Hamburg]], and went for instruction in German to General D'Angeli, a French émigré. D'Angeli, without using a grammar book, translated to him word for word a German book of anecdotes, parsing as he proceeded; and after about twelve lessons Hamilton found that he could read some German books. Beatty and Mulhall had had a somewhat similar system.<ref name="DNB"/>
Moving to Paris Hamilton with the banking-house of Karcher & Co., did business with England at the time of the [[Peace of Amiens]]. At the end of the Pace in 1803 he was detained, and his business was ruined.<ref name="DNB"/>
Hamilton went to New York in October 1815, with the idea of becoming a farmer and manufacturing [[potash]]. He changed his mind, and began to teach languages. His method started with a word-for-word translation, and left instruction in grammar till a later stage. His first pupils were three ministers and Judge [[William P. Van Ness]] of the District Court; he charged a dollar a lesson, and taught pupils to read French in 24 lessons of four hours each.<ref name="DNB"/>
In September 1816 Hamilton went to [[Philadelphia]], and gave a lecture on the "Hamiltonian System". In 1817 he moved on to [[Baltimore]], his wife and daughters teaching with him. The professors at Baltimore College ridiculed him in a play, ''The New Mode of Teaching'', acted by their pupils. Hamilton went to the play, and three days later published it in a newspaper, with his own comments. He claimed a Hamiltonian school at Baltimore, with more than 160 pupils and 20 teachers. Bad health and money troubles meant he went on to Washington.<ref name="DNB"/>
At Boston, Hamilton could only obtain four pupils. A professor at [[Boston University]] attacked him as a charlatan, but a committee examined his pupils, and he soon had 200. He taught also at colleges in Schenectady, Princeton, Yale, Hartford, and Middleburg.<ref name="DNB"/>
In 1822 Hamilton went to [[Montreal]], and then to [[Quebec]]. At Montreal he instructed a gaoler, and then successfully taught reading to eight English prisoners there. He left America in July 1823, and came to London, where in eighteen months he had more than 600 pupils learning different languages, and seven teachers. He left his school to the teachers, and afterwards taught his system in Liverpool, Manchester, Edinburgh, Dublin, Belfast, and at least other places. In London he taught at his house, No. 25 Cecil Street, [[Strand, London|Strand]], and then in [[Gower Street, London|Gower Street]].<ref name="DNB"/>
As an experiment over six months in 1825 saw ten school boys live in Hamilton's house. At the end of the period they were examined in Latin translation, French and Italian. The expenses of this experiment were partly borne by John Smith, M.P. Hamilton's system and extensive advertising were attacked by school-masters and others. A defence by [[Sydney Smith]] appeared in the ''[[Edinburgh Review]]'' for June 1826. The Hamiltonian system was also defended in the ''[[Westminster Review]]''.<ref name="DNB"/>
Hamilton died in Dublin on 16 September 1829, in his sixtieth year.<ref name="DNB"/>
==Works== [[File:Jul. Cesar Commentarii De Bello Gallico Liber Primus.jpg|thumb|Hamiltonian system, interlinear Swedish text for ''[[De Bello Gallico]]'']] In Philadelphia Hamilton printed his first reading-book, chapters i–iii. of St. John's Gospel, in French, with an interlinear translation. Further books with literal and interlinear English translations published by Hamilton, and mostly of gospels and classics, appeared in [[Ancient Greek]], Latin including [[Charles François Lhomond]]'s ''Epitome Historiæ Sacræ'', French including [[Jean Baptiste Perrin (fl. 1786)|Jean Baptiste Perrin]]'s ''Fables'', German including [[Joachim Heinrich Campe]]'s ''Robinson Crusoe'', and Italian. In time unauthorised books appeared, professing to be adapted to his system.<ref name="DNB"/>

[[File:Honda Step WGN rear right.JPG|thumb|right|A Japanese-market [[Honda Stepwgn]] in the [[Philippines]]. The model has never seen an official release in the country, and has to be converted to left-hand drive for it to be driven legally.]]
'''Japanese used vehicle exporting''' is a [[Grey import vehicle|grey market]] [[international trade]] involving the [[export]] of [[used car]]s and other vehicles from Japan to other markets around the world since the 1980s.
Despite the high cost of transport, the sale of used cars and other vehicles to other countries is still profitable due to the relatively low cost and good condition of the vehicles being purchased. Contributing factors to the feasibility of such export include Japan's strict [[Motor-vehicle inspection (Japan)|motor-vehicle inspections]] and high [[depreciation]] which make such vehicles worth very little in Japan after six years, and strict environmental-protection regulations that make vehicle disposal very expensive in Japan. Japan has very stringent [[Emission standard#Japan|vehicle emission test standards]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kantei.go.jp/foreign/koizumispeech/2003/03/28yosan_e.html |title=Opening Statement by Prime Minister Junichiro Koizumi at the Press Conference on the Passage of the FY2003 Budget |accessdate=2008-10-14 |date=2003-03-28 }}</ref>
Nearly 1.4 million used vehicles were exported from Japan in 2006.{{Citation needed|date=May 2011}} The most popular destinations for used cars from Japan are [[Pakistan]], [[Sri Lanka]], [[Bangladesh]], [[Russia]], [[Mongolia]], [[Kazakhstan]], [[Jamaica]], [[Trinidad and Tobago]], [[New Zealand]], [[Tanzania]], [[Zambia]], [[Zimbabwe]], [[Malaysia]], [[Brunei]], [[Australia]], [[Canada]], [[Democratic Republic of the Congo|Congo]], [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]], [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]], [[Dominican Republic]], [[Peru]], [[Bolivia]], [[Paraguay]], [[Kenya]], the [[United Kingdom]], [[United States]], [[Thailand]], [[Myanmar]], [[Hong Kong]] and (until recently) [[Indonesia]], [[Philippines]]. Additionally, [[Chile]], [[Singapore]], [[South Africa]] and the [[United Arab Emirates]] are used as popular transit hubs.{{Citation needed|date=May 2011}}
==Overview==
===Supply of used cars=== In Japan, used cars are mainly sold at [[auto auction]]s by car owners and dealers. At auto auctions, owners are hidden from bidders while the auctioneers provide independent car evaluations called inspection sheets.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://japan-used-car-exporting.info/import/inspection-sheets.html |title=Japanese Used Car Exporting - Inspection Sheets|publisher=Japan-used-car-exporting.info |date= |accessdate=2011-05-30}}</ref> Exporters, acting as bidding agents for importers, use the auto auctions as their main supply.{{Citation needed|date=May 2011}} There are over 200 auto auction groups operating throughout Japan including JAA, JU Group, TAA, USS, and ZIP.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://japan-used-car-exporting.info/import/auto-auctions-in-japan.html |title=Japanese Used Car Exporting - Auto Auctions in Japan |publisher=Japan-used-car-exporting.info |date= |accessdate=2011-04-03}}</ref>
Besides auto auctions, Japanese exports have access to vehicles from [[Dealerships#Japan|dealerships]] and private sellers.
===Exporting methods=== Vehicles which will be exported from Japan must be prepared before shipping. This includes de-registering the vehicle with the government, getting an export certificate, and cleaning the car to remove [[biosecurity]] risks. Car cleaning is especially necessary for the [[Australian Quarantine and Inspection Service]] (AQIS)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.daff.gov.au/aqis/import/vehicles-machinery/motor-vehicles |title=Importing Motor Vehicles |publisher=DAFF |date=2010-10-11 |accessdate=2011-04-03 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110331193523/http://www.daff.gov.au/aqis/import/vehicles-machinery/motor-vehicles |archivedate=2011-03-31 |df= }}</ref> and New Zealand's [[Ministry of Primary Industries (New Zealand)|Ministry of Primary Industries (MPI)]]<ref>[http://www.biosecurity.govt.nz/commercial-imports/other-imports/introduction Other Imports | MPI Biosecurity New Zealand] {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071221113451/http://www.biosecurity.govt.nz/commercial-imports/other-imports/introduction |date=December 21, 2007 }}</ref> agencies' clearances.
Exporters can ship the car that is ready by [[Roll-on/roll-off|ro-ro]] or [[Containerization|container]] according to customer specification, ship schedules, and the capabilities of the destination port.
===Market differences=== The suitability of Japan's domestically sold cars for export to other countries is constrained by various factors. Vehicles in Japan have [[Right- and left-hand traffic|right-hand drive]]—the driver's seat is on the right side of the vehicle—in accord with Japan's left-hand traffic. Some countries with right-hand traffic permit right-hand drive vehicles, though [[Headlamp#Compatibility with traffic directionality|right-traffic headlamps]] are generally unavailable for models exclusive to Japan.<ref>''Considerations for Approval of Lighting Equipment on Vehicles Imported to Canada'', Daniel Stern Lighting Consultancy, 2006, pp. 6-7</ref> Some countries with right traffic do not allow right-hand drive cars, but in some such markets the extensive labor required to convert a car to left-hand drive is economically feasible; such conversions are sometimes done by the local importers. The Philippines is an example of a market where such conversion is common, until recently, when the importation of such used vehicles (except for heavy vehicles) was banned by E0 156.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.topgear.com.ph/news/lto-customs-to-strictly-enforce-eo-156-ban-on-surplus-cars|title=LTO, Customs to strictly enforce EO 156 ban on 'surplus cars'|date=15 February 2013|work=Top Gear Philippines}}</ref> Japan's [[automobile safety]] regulations also differ substantially from the [[ECE Regulations]] used throughout most of the world and the U.S. [[National Highway Traffic Safety Administration|North American regulations]] that apply in the [[United States]] and [[Canada]].<ref>[http://www.ivoac.ca/docs/IVOACPerspective.pdf Perspective on Proposed Changes to Vehicle Import Regulations in Canada]</ref> Vehicle components such as [[Tempered glass#Uses|windows]] and [[windshield]]s, [[seat belt]]s, [[Automotive lighting|lamps and reflectors]], and [[Wing mirror|mirrors]], as well as design features for [[crashworthiness]] such as [[Bumper (automobile)|bumpers]], fuel tanks, and structural rigidity of vehicles meant for the Japanese market may not comply with non-Japanese standards.<ref>[http://www.japanoid.com/stop25.php Stop the 25-year rule]</ref><ref name="15yadr1">[http://autospeed.com/cms/title_15yo-ADRing-Part-One/A_2306/article.html 15yo ADR-ing — Part 1]</ref><ref>[http://autospeed.com/cms/title_15yo-ADRing-Part-Two/A_2307/article.html 15yo ADR-ing — Part 2]</ref> They often lack structural reinforcements needed to meet side-impact crashworthiness standards in effect outside Japan.<ref name="15yadr1"/> Moreover, entire categories of vehicle, such as [[Kei car]]s, do not exist in regulations outside Japan.<ref>[http://www.nhtsa.gov/cars/rules/rulings/lsv/lsv.html ''63 FR 33913'' U.S. Department of Transportation Final Rule]</ref><ref>[http://www.popularmechanics.com/cars/news/4255883 Can America Find True Happiness in a Microcar?]</ref>
===Responsibilities=== {{Unreferenced section|date=May 2011}} Generally, most exporters are responsible for the organization and completion of the vehicle's transportation until it arrives at the importer's Port of Destination (POD). At the POD, possession of the vehicle, and the responsibility of possession, is laid on the importer. ''Financial responsibility'', on the other hand, is transferred when ownership is handed over. Ownership is switched after the car has been purchased and before being exported. In the case of damage or losses occurring during shipping, the buyer is the one bears all financial loss.
===Car export companies verification=== Whilst the majority of websites in Japan are of genuine business companies, there are [http://www.japancompanytrust.org/complaints/] scams and fraud in Japan. Foreign importers must verify each company, and transfer money only when transactions are satisfactorily completed. Verification of Japanese companies under the Japan Company Trust Organization can be helpful.
==To specific countries== {{refimprove section|date=October 2016}}
===Canada=== Any vehicle more than 15 years old may be imported into Canada without regard to its compliance with Canada Motor Vehicle Safety Standards. Vehicles are registered at the provincial level in Canada, and increasingly stringent sub-national vehicle safety requirements make it difficult to register a Japanese-market vehicle without replacement or modifications to the [[headlamp]]s and [[Automotive lighting|other lights and reflectors]], window glass, tires, seatbelts and other equipment.
===Chile=== In Chile, second hand imported vehicles may only be registered in the extreme regions of [[Arica and Parinacota Region|Arica and Parinacota]], [[Tarapacá Region|Tarapacá]], [[Aisén Region|Aisén]] and [[Magallanes y la Antártica Chilena Region|Magallanes]]. Japanese used vehicles must meet emission standards and be converted to [[Right- and left-hand traffic|left hand drive]]. However, a big market of non converted cars exists in the duty-free zone of [[Iquique]], where customers from other countries buy them and sometimes drive them home.
===Hong Kong===
[[File:Toyota bB Front side view.jpg|thumb|2002 [[Toyota bB]], Japan Domestic version, exported and registered in Hong Kong.]]
There are quite a lot of used cars from Japan registered in [[Hong Kong]], including both Japanese makes and even European makes, since both Hong Kong and Japan are right hand drive. In order to register the car in Hong Kong, the car must be less than 7 years old, [[gasoline]] powered, meets [[Euro V]] emission and noise standard, with E-mark for all glass and safety belts, and [[Unleaded gasoline|unleaded-fuel]] restrictor installed. For cars over 20 years old, they can be imported as classic cars and need not meet Euro V emission standard. In addition, Hong Kong does not accept privacy windows. If a Japanese used car is fitted with privacy windows, it must be converted to clear glass in order to register in Hong Kong.
===Ireland=== [[File:Greystones, Co Wicklow - Ireland (4572649828).jpg|thumb|[[Toyota WiLL]] in [[Dublin]]]] [[Republic of Ireland|Ireland]] has relatively loose vehicle importing laws for Japanese cars. To keep imports down, Irish Revenue Commissioners require all new and imported cars to pay the [[vehicle registration tax (Ireland)|VRT]]. Also, every car, both domestic and imported over four years old must pass the stringent [[National Car Test]] (NCT) in order to be given a road worthiness certificate. In the case of cars imported from Japan, all glass, tyres, noise, must meet EU approved levels.
===Kenya=== In Kenya, second-hand imported Japanese vehicles must undergo a worthiness inspection conducted by the Japan Export Vehicle Inspection Center as per mandate from the Kenya Bureau of Standards. The inspection aims to ensure that the vehicles are not more than 8 years old, are right hand drive, have genuine mileage and that the vehicles pass a safety & mechanical inspection similar to the Japanese periodic inspection.<ref>[https://support.carfromjapan.com/hc/en-us/articles/203105279--Import-Regulations-Kenya- Import Regulations (Kenya)]</ref>
=== Macau === Although [[Macau]] is right hand drive, it does not allow imports of used car from Japan or any other country, unlike Hong Kong. However, brand new parallel imported cars from Japan are allowed in Macau.
===Malta=== [[File:MHV Toyota Ist 2005 01.jpg|thumb|[[Toyota ist]], registered in Malta]] In Malta, second-hand imported Japanese vehicles must comply with Road Worthiness regulations which address Emissions, Lights Operability & Mechanical Operability. Vehicles thus in compliance can be imported and registered. Some Maltese importers apply corrosion protection to these vehicles due to the hot, humid climate.
===New Zealand=== [[File:2001 Nissan March Bolero (7159199865).jpg|thumb|Nissan March Bolero, imported to New Zealand]] New Zealand has stringent safety and emission standards. Besides [[biosecurity]] and customs clearances, a vehicle must be Entry Certified by a Transport Services Delivery Agent (TSDA) which includes checking that paper data and physical data meet safety, emissions, and fuel consumption standards.<ref>http://aretcars.com/export-import-regulations/</ref>
===Pakistan=== [[Pakistan]] applies strict controls on imports. Imported cars must be not more than 3 years old. High import taxes are levied on imported vehicles.<ref>[http://www.pakmission-uk.gov.pk/commsection/downloads/import_of_vehicles_090904.pdf ''Import of Vehicles''], High Commission for Pakistan</ref> Special ships are sometimes used for exporting vehicles to Pakistan to meet the rising demand.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=story_7-8-2005_pg5_13 |title=Leading News Resource of Pakistan |publisher=Daily Times |date=2005-08-07 |accessdate=2011-04-03 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110607033034/http://www.dailytimes.com.pk/default.asp?page=story_7-8-2005_pg5_13 |archivedate=2011-06-07 |df= }}</ref>
===Russia=== While Russia has [[right hand traffic]], it allows the importation of LHT vehicles if they pass the technical inspection. This is compulsory for all street-legal vehicles in Russia. Although a prohibitively high import tariff is levied on cars more than 7 years old, to protect local industry, the oldest Japanese vehicles usually pass the inspection, if they were well maintained. Vehicles imported to Russia are sometimes exported to [[North Korea]] and [[Central Asia]].
===United Kingdom=== Importing rules for the [[United Kingdom|UK]] are stringent. All vehicles must undergo Individual Vehicle Approval to assure compliance with applicable [[ECE Regulations]] or British national equivalents. The [[speedometer]] must be converted from kilometres per hour to miles per hour, a [[Automotive lighting|rear fog light]] and [[Unleaded gasoline|unleaded-fuel]] restrictor installed.
===United States=== Vehicles at least 25 years old may be imported to the US regardless of non-compliance with that country's [[Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standards]].<ref>http://www.nhtsa.gov/cars/rules/import/FAQ%20Site/pages/page2.html#Anchor-28852</ref> Vehicles are registered at the state level in the US, and increasingly stringent sub-national vehicle safety requirements make it difficult to register a Japanese-market vehicle without replacement or modifications to the [[headlamp]]s and [[Automotive lighting|other lights and reflectors]], window glass, tires, seatbelts and other equipment.

She appeared for the first time in the [[Studio El-Fan]] series debuts as a [[South Governorate|South Lebanese]] competitor from 2001–02. Abboud's musical career flourished with the release of her first album ''[[Fi Shouq]]'' ({{lang-ar|في شوق}}: on longing) published in late 2007.{{cite web|title=ليال عبود layal abboud|url=http://asraroki.com/2016/04/ليال-عبود/|website=asraroki.com/|publisher=Asraroki|accessdate=24 August 2017}} Sings in different [[Arabic dialects]], famous for her presentation of Lebanese folklore music and [[List of tours and concerts by Layal Abboud|internal summer concerts and tours]].{{cite web|title=The official lebanese Top 20 – Layal Abboud|url=http://www.theofficiallebanesetop20.com/Layal_Abboud#&panel1-3|website=The official lebanese Top 20}} Abboud is a singer member in the [[Syndicate of Professional Artists in Lebanon]].{{cite web|title=layale abboud|url=http://alfananine.com/index/?p=1099&lang=en|website=alfananine.com|publisher=Syndicate Of Professional Artists In Lebanon|accessdate=24 August 2017}} == Biography == === Early life and education === Layal Abboud was born into a large Muslim family on May 15, 1982 in the [[South Governorate|southern]] village of [[Kniseh, Tyre|Kanisah]] in Lebanon's [[Tyre District]]. Abboud's father and mother, named Mounir and Maryam, had three brothers and six sisters between them. As a child Abboud started singing and dancing and was a [[Fan (person)|fan]] of [[Egypt]]ian pop singer [[Amr Diab]].{{cite web|title=Al Kahera Wal Nas|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3LcMvesgyTM|website=youtube.com|publisher=You Tube|date=15 June 2017}} Her father encouraged her and bought her a violin while she was six years old.{{cite web |title=لا أرغب أن يخوض أطفالي تجربة الفن … ليال عبود لـ"الوطن": الأغنية الشعبية السورية متصدرة في سباق الأغاني العربية… ولأنها تستهويني لدي أغنية "مغنج" |url=http://alwatan.sy/archives/115221 |website=alwatan.sy |publisher=alwatan.sy |accessdate=19 June 2018 |date=15 August 2017}} Starting at age 14 she worked as a [[private tutor]] for more than 13 students.{{cite web|title=ليال عبود:وضع مسدساً في رأسي ولولا العناية الإلهية لما خرجتُ سالمة – ليالينا|url=https://www.layalina.com/ليال-عبودوضع-مسدساً-في-رأسي-ولولا-العناية-الإلهية-لما-خرجتُ-سالمة-0.html|website=ليالينا|language=ar}}{{Cite web |url=https://www.elfann.com/news/show/1182791/ليال-عبود:-كنت-الأمن-الداخلي..-وطليقي-حاول-يردعني |title=ليال عبود: كنت في الأمن الداخلي.. وطليقي حاول أن يردعني |website=elfann.com |publisher=El-Fann |access-date=25 August 2017}}{{cite web|title=ليال عبود: "نجرحت كتير لأنو قلبي طيب"..نيكولا داغر: "حلمي التلفزيون وكل شي بوقتو"|url=https://www.elfann.com/news/show/1092533/ليال-عبود:-نجرحت-كتير-لأنو-قلبي-طيب..نيكولا-داغر:-|website=Elfann News|publisher=Elfann News|language=ar-AR|date=July 23, 2014}} Abboud studied English literature at the [[Lebanese University]] and translation in [[Beirut Arab University]], graduating with a [[master's degree]].{{Cite web |url=https://www.elfann.com/news/show/1122897/ليال-عبود-:شيفرة-تمام-بليق-كانت-شيفرة-إما-أفتحها-ع |title=ليال عبود :"شيفرة تمام بليق كانت شيفرة إما أفتحها على نفسي أو أغلقها" |website=elfann.com |publisher=El-Fann |access-date=24 August 2017}} She went on to study music at the Lebanese National Higher Conservatory of music for two years. Abboud served as an [[Police officer|officer]] for the [[Internal Security Forces|Lebanese Police Force]], working security for two years in the [[Beirut–Rafic Hariri International Airport]]'s Inspection Department.{{cite web|title="سيدتي نت" تكشف سجلاّت ليال عبود في الشرطة اللبنانية|url=http://www.sayidaty.net/node/279736/فن-ومشاهير/أخبار-المشاهير/سيدتي-نت-تكشف-سجلاّت-ليال-عبود-في-الشرطة-اللبنانية|website=sayidaty.net|publisher=Sayidaty Magazine|accessdate=24 August 2017}}{{cite web|title=BAYNETNA / 2012 Layal Abboud|url=http://mtv.com.lb/Programs/Baynetna/2012/videos/Layal_Abboud/|website=mtv.com.lb|publisher=[[MTV Lebanon]]|language=Arabic|format=Interview|date=June 30, 2012}} === Musical career === Abboud appeared on TV for the first time on the hit show [[Studio El-Fan]] as a competitor for its 2001–02 season.{{Cite web |url=http://www.alittihad.ae/details.php?id=10749&y=2012&article=full |title=ليال عبود تتمنى تجسيد حياة مارلين مونرو وتستعد لألبوم جديد |website=alittihad.ae |publisher=Al-Ittihad |access-date=24 August 2017}} She sang at various Beirut cafés and restaurants, eventually networking with musicians like Richard Najm, Tony Abi Karam, and Salim Salameh.{{cite web|title=Layal – Fi Shouq|url=http://www.balaha-records.com/epages/61149572.sf/en_GB/?ObjectPath=/Shops/61149572/Products/BR-CD-02133|website=www.balaha-records.com|language=en}} Abboud went on to study music under Richard Najm, and in 2006 became a [[multi-instrumentalist]] skilled in the [[oud]], [[Organ (music)|organ]] and [[guitar]].{{cite web|title=ليال عبود: انسحبت من استديو الفن لأنطلق بقوة|url=http://jouhina.com/magazine/archive_article.php?id=103|publisher=Jouhina Magazine}} Her first album, ''[[Fi Shouq]]'' ({{lang-ar|في شوق}}: ''On Longing'') was released in late 2007. In an interview with Egyptian media about her [[penchant]] to [[music]], Abboud has stated, "[[Music]] is my [[life]]!" Abboud's inspirations include [[Ammar El Sherei]], [[Baligh Hamdi]] and [[Sabah (singer)|Sabah]]{{Cite web |url=http://www.alraimedia.com/ar/article/celebrities/2016/06/20/688465/nr/lebanon |title=ليال عبود: جنوني مُخيفٌ... ومُدمّر |website=alraimedia.com |publisher=[[Al Rai (Kuwaiti newspaper)|Al Rai]]|access-date=24 August 2017}} whom Abboud called the "ideal of my art career."{{cite web|title=ليال عبود: "لا أتمنى الوصول الى نهاية صباح وأنافس أم كلثوم|url=http://www.wen.co.il/ليال-عبود:-لا-أتمنى-الوصول-الى-نهاية-صباح-وأنافس-أم-كلثوم/28905.news|website=wen.co.il|publisher=wen}} In July 2014 Abboud also said that she is "very much drawn to French musicians, possibly because I’m a bit of a hopeless romantic." In addition to being a singer and musician, Abboud is also a poet and [[composer]], though says that she refrains from publishing her poetry or compositions in order to focus on her musical career as advised by her manager Dory Shehade. === Business and fashion === [[File:Layal Abboud - Plaza Palace Ceremony - Beirut - July 2015 - Lebanon 19.jpg|thumb|upright|Layal Abboud dressed by Akel Fakih, performing for [[Eid al-Fitr]] ceremony, [[Beirut]]; July 18, 2015.]] In 2014 Abboud called Akel Fakih "the mastermind" behind the way she dresses in her professional, social, and daily life. In 2015 Akel Fakih said he works with Layal Abboud "in a very distinctive and upscale way, going on to say that, "there is a chemistry that brings me together in fashion. She trusts my opinion and tastes, and this is one of the reasons why Layal chose me in her concerts."{{cite web|title=عقل فقيه :"غنّجت ليال عبّود بخمسة لوكات في عملها الجديد"|url=https://www.elfann.com/news/show/1132351/عقل-فقيه-:غنّجت-ليال-عبّود-بخمسة-لوكات-عملها-الجدي|website=Elfann News|publisher=Elfann News|language=ar-AR}} Abboud has elaborated on her fashion team, saying, "Elie Samaan does my hair and makeup; my stylist is Serene Assaad, and my photographer is Hussein Salman."{{cite web|title=Episode 29 – Layal Abboud Interview|url=https://www.lbcgroup.tv/watch/chapter/27354/47577/layal-abboud-interview/en|website=lbcgroup.tv|publisher=[[Lebanese Broadcasting Corporation International]]|accessdate=24 August 2017}}{{cite web|title=ماهي حقيقة خلاف ليال عبود و عقل فقيه ؟ {{!}} دنيا الوطن|url=https://www.alwatanvoice.com/arabic/news/2017/03/27/1032967.html|website=دنيا الوطن|publisher=Donia Al Watan|date=March 27, 2017}}
On 12 October 2017, She appeared publicly for the first as a fit and fashion model dressed and designed by Akl Fakih, in ''Design & Brands Event'' held at the Four Seasons Hotel of Beirut.{{cite web|title=ليال عبود تختار فستان زفاف من مجموعة عقل فقيه لعام 2018 {{!}} مجلة اليقظة|url=http://www.alyaqza.com/ليال-عبود-بفستان-زفاف-من-عقل-فقيه-لعام-2018/|website=www.alyaqza.com|publisher=alyaqza.com|accessdate=5 December 2017|language=ar|date=12 October 2017}}
Abboud is founder of [[Amman]]-based wedding planning company Loulou Secret. She also runs Layal Productions for her music. === Media issues === Sometimes called a [[Seduction|seductive artist]] and [[femme fatale]] by [[Al Akhbar (Lebanon)|Al Akhbar]] and other critics,{{cite web|title=وقفة {{!}} "نادين" عوني الكعكي: "بلاي بوي" لبناني!|url=http://www.al-akhbar.com/node/255780|website=الأخبار|language=ar}}{{cite web|title=تمام بليق... وزاد في الابتذال حتى انفلق|url=http://al-akhbar.com/node/227096|website=الأخبار|language=ar}}{{cite web|title=ليال عبود لـنادين الإشارة ركن أساسي عند الأنثي النجمة الأميركية فانيسا هادجنز بعد وفاة والدها كان لابد من تجاوز الأزمة|url=http://www.alanba.com.kw/ar/last/642037/11-04-2016-ليال-عبود-لـنادينالاشارة-ركن-اساسي-عند-الانثي-النجمة-الاميركية-فانيسا-هادجنز-بعد-وفاة-والدهاكان-لابد-تجاوز-الازمة|website=alanba.com.kw|language=ar}} Abboud appeared on the program ''Bala Teshfir'' on the [[Al Jadeed]] network in 2015, stating, "Being bold is not seduction".{{cite web|title=بلا تشفير حلقة ليال عبود|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1X7bS7BtPO4|website=youtube.com|publisher=You Tube|date=28 January 2017}}{{cite web|title=ليال عبود ترد على الأقلام الصفراء…|url=http://aldadpress.com/post/16269|website=الضاد برس|language=ar-AR|date=16 June 2015}} She believes there is a bias against her and said, "I am a normal artist and contemporary with [[fashion design|fashion]]."{{cite web|last1=Hasnaa|first1=Al|title=الحسناء {{!}} ليال عبود لـ "الحسناء": أضع بعض التصريحات تحت أقدامي لكي أرتفع أكثر|url=http://www.alhasnaa.com/news/subjects/فن-و-مشاهير/2017/02/24/ليال-عبود-ل-الحسناء-أضع-بعض-التصريحات-تحت-أقدامي-لكي-أرتفع-أكثر|website=الحسناء|language=ar}} In 2016 [[counterfeit]] images were published attributed to Abboud's likeness. She appointed attorney Haitham Tarshishi to file a [[lawsuit]] against "all those involved in the forgery of a picture attributed to her through [[social media]] sites, accompanied by words beyond the limits of fitness."{{cite web|title=ليال عبود توكل محامي للدفاع عن المسيئين لها بسبب صورتها المزيفة|url=http://www.sayidaty.net/node/419526/فن-ومشاهير/أخبار-المشاهير/ليال-عبود-توكل-محامي-للدفاع-عن-المسيئين-لها-بسبب-صورتها-المزيفة#photo/4|website=sayidaty.net|publisher=Sayidaty Magazine|accessdate=24 August 2017}} In August 2016 [[LBCI|the Lebanese Broadcasting Corporation]] reported that a suspect had been arrested.{{cite web|title=إلقاء القبض على مزوّر صورة|url=https://www.lbcgroup.tv/news/d/fann/278618/إلقاء-القبض-على-مزور-صورة-غير-لائقة-للفنانة-ليال-ع/ar|website=www.lbcgroup.tv|publisher=Lebanese Broadcasting Corporation International}} In April 2017 as a guest on the [[LBCI]] [[satire|satirical]] program ''La-hon Wa-bas'' hosted by Hicham Haddad, Abboud condemned an issue of ''[[Nadine Magazine]]'' for its depiction of her [[Female body shape|chest and face shape]] with the words, "Bigger than this chest" emblazoned on its cover, based on her quote while she used Arabic word of [[wikt:صدر#Arabic|ṣadr]] which can be an invocation for conscience and heart.{{cite web|title=وشوشة {{!}} ليال عبود تكشف حقيقة ما نشر عن صدرها في مجلة نادين Washwasha|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IDlNpDbM_cM|date=29 April 2016}} She accused the magazine of trying to increase readership by [[dumbing down]] and [[Oversimplification|oversimplifying]] its content.{{cite web|title=لبنان: عنوان بتلميحات جنسية لمجلة حول صورة ليال عبود يثير جدلاً واسعاً.. والفنانة ترد: قصدي شريف!|url=https://arabic.cnn.com/entertainment/2016/04/10/layal-abboud-magazine-cover|website=arabic.cnn.com|publisher=CNN Arabic|accessdate=24 August 2017}} Earlier in Jun 26, 2017 strongly criticized yellow-pens of Lebanese music journalists.{{Cite web |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X-q4xxhdc0g&t=131s |title=حكي عالمكشوف مع الفنانة ليال عبّود |date=26 June 2017 |publisher=OTV Lebanon}} === Personal life === Moved to [[Beirut]] in 2009. Abboud cares about her [[physical health]] and [[elegance]].{{cite web|title=ليال عبود : الطبيعة صيدلية الجمال|url=http://www.anazahra.com/beauty/beauty-interviews/article-8027/ليال-عبود-الطبيعة-صيدلية-الجمال/|website=أنا زهرة}} In June 2017 she publicly confirmed that she had undergone [[rhinoplasty]], but that the rest of her features were not the result of plastic surgery, stating, "The secret of my beauty is sport".{{cite web|title=ليال عبود: جسمي كله طبيعي .. وسر جمالي الرياضة|url=http://www.face-msr.com/t~500741|website=face-msr.com|publisher=Face Misr|accessdate=24 August 2017}}{{cite web|title=شيخ الحارة ؛لقاء بسمة وهبه مع ليال عبود القاهرة والناس القاهرة والناس|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q7cTnAk54dI|website=youtube.com/|publisher=You Tube|accessdate=24 August 2017}} She is an advocate for a public [[smoking ban]] for Lebanon, saying, "Smoking and non-smoking areas must be allocated".{{cite web|title=ليال عبّود: "طَبخي" يُغنيني عن الدهون والحرمان|url=http://www.aljoumhouria.com/pages/view/96040|website=Al-Joumhouria|publisher=Al-Joumhouria}} Having had an interest in sport and [[horseback riding]] since childhood, Abboud has four horses, which she keeps in the village of Tanbourit in Lebanon's [[Sidon District]]. Their names are Rim, Loulou, Khaybar (named after [[Khaibar-1]] ) and Layal (named after her given name).{{Cite web |url=https://www.elfann.com/news/show/1154314/ليال-عبود-زوجي-خانني-وخفت-عنوان-أكبر-هيدا-الصدر |title=ليال عبود "زوجي خانني وخفت من عنوان "في أكبر من هيدا الصدر" |website=elfann.com |publisher=El-Fann}} Abboud is a practising Muslim.{{cite web |title=ليال عبود: جنوني مُخيفٌ... ومُدمّر! |url=http://www.alraimedia.com/Home/Details?Id=f7e0b6f9-088d-480c-a21b-73881b32bb0a |accessdate=19 June 2018 |date=20 June 2016}} She fasts and abstains from performing during [[Ramadan]], and holds the pre-dawn and post-sunset meals of [[Suhur]] and [[Iftar]] with her family.{{cite web|title=ليال عبود: أفطّر ستة أيتام في رمضان.. وأخدمهم|url=http://www.alhayat.com/Articles/15945048/ليال-عبود--أفطّر-ستة-أيتام-في-رمضان---وأخدمهم|website=alhayat.com/|publisher=[[Al-Hayat]]|date=June 7, 2016}}{{cite web|title=ليال عبود توزع الاغذية و الالعاب على الفقراء المزيد على دنيا الوطن .. |url=https://www.alwatanvoice.com/arabic/news/2017/06/20/1061157.html|website=alwatanvoice.com|publisher=دنيا الوطن – Donia Al Watan|accessdate=23 August 2017}} Involved in philanthropic activities {{cite web|title=ليال عبود تقديم وجبات للمتسولين في بيروت هؤلاء الأطفال أمانة في أعناقنا وتيلر سويفت تتصدر قائمة فوربس لاتزال متربعة في القمة|url=http://www.alanba.com.kw/ar/last/699932/18-11-2016-ليال-عبود-تقديم-وجبات-للمتسولين-بيروت-هؤلاء-الأطفال-أمانة-أعناقنا-وتيلر-سويفت-تتصدر-قائمة-فوربس-لاتزال-متربعة-القمة|website=alanba.com.kw|language=ar}} and has described herself as an "abnormal generous person." On Mid-January 2018 her home was burglarized and robbed of Jewelry and Cash, estimated at about 100,000 US $ by her assistant.{{cite news |title=مساعد ليال عبود يسرق مجوهراتها ويهددها... ''أفلام مشينة'' في هاتفه |url=https://www.annahar.com/article/735130-مساعد-ليال-عبود-يسرق-مجوهراتها-ويهددها-أفلام-مشينة-في-هاتفه |work=An-Nahar |date=17 January 2018}} === Marriage and family === Abboud married at the age of sixteen in 1998 and gave birth to her only son, Jad, in 2005.{{cite web|title=ليال عبود للمرة الأولى: جاد ابني وأخفيته عن الاعلام لهذا السبب!|url=https://aljaras.com/ليال-عبود-للمرة-الأولى-جاد-ابني-وأخفيت/|website=aljaras.com|publisher=Al-Jaras|accessdate=24 August 2017}} She eventually [[divorce in Islam|divorced]] her husband, later describing the marriage as "very formal," adding, "My early marriage was the result of a love story. I am a romantic and dreamy woman." In June 2017 she said, "By respect among us, we divorced and I chose my career in art." In August 2017 Abboud spoke about her relation with a Lebanese diplomat, saying that it had ended because of their divergent career paths.{{cite web|title=مجلة اليمامة|url=http://sites.alriyadh.com/alyamamah/article/1162128|website=sites.alriyadh.com|language=ar}} On May 5, 2015 said there is a [[Romance (love)|new love story]] in her life.{{cite web|title=خاص الفن- ليال عبود: أصبحت خجولة.. وأعيش قصة حب|url=http://www.elfann.com/news/show/1212352/خاص-الفن--%23ليال_عبود-أصبحت-خجولة..-وأعيش-قصة|website=elfann.com|language=ar}} About her relationship with her family, on June 15, 2017 said she was very much related to her father Mounir when lived between her family. {{main|World Branding Awards}}
[[File:World Branding Awards Trophy.jpg|thumb|The World Branding Awards trophy is on display at the [[Museum of Brands, Packaging & Advertising]] in London]] The '''List of World Branding Awards winners''' provide details of the winners of the [[World Branding Awards]], an international award presented to some of the best global and national brands for their work and achievements in [[brand management|branding]].<ref name=TTR>{{cite news|title=Taiwan’s Acer and Chatime Honoured at the 2014 World Branding Awards|url=http://taiwantradereview.com/taiwans-acer-and-chatime-honoured-at-the-2014-world-branding-awards/|accessdate=5 December 2014|publisher=Taiwan Trade Review|date=29 Oct 2014}}</ref> The awards are organised by the [[World Branding Forum]], a registered global non-profit organisation based in London.<ref name=star-maybank>{{cite news|title=Maybank awarded Brand of the Year at World Branding Forum|url=http://www.thestar.com.my/Business/Business-News/2014/10/29/Maybank-awarded-Brand-of-the-Year-at-World-Branding-Forum/?style=biz|accessdate=5 December 2014|publisher=The Star|date=29 Oct 2014}}</ref>
The first awards ceremony was held at [[Whitehall Court|One Whitehall Place]] at the [[Royal Horseguards Hotel]] in [[London]] on October 26, 2014. The event was hosted by [[David Croft (broadcaster)|David Croft]] from [[Sky Sports]].<ref name=yahoo-finance>{{cite news|title=Asian Brands Honoured at the 2014 World Branding Awards|url=https://finance.yahoo.com/news/asian-brands-honoured-2014-world-160500286.html|accessdate=21 February 2015|publisher=Yahoo Finance|date=29 Oct 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150216100702/https://finance.yahoo.com/news/asian-brands-honoured-2014-world-160500286.html|archivedate=16 February 2015|df=}}</ref>
Sixty nine brands from 25 countries won an award.<ref name=boston>{{cite news|title=Apple, Coca-Cola, HSBC and Louis Vuitton Named "Brand of the Year" at the 2014 World Branding Awards|url=http://finance.boston.com/boston/news/read/28565434/Apple|accessdate=21 February 2015|publisher=Boston Times|date=28 Oct 2014}}</ref> Each brand is named "Brand of the Year" in their respective categories.<ref name=yahoo-finance/> The "Brand of the Year" logo is a [[trademark|registered trademark]].<ref name="EUIPO">{{cite web|title=World branding Awards Brand Of The Year|url=https://euipo.europa.eu/eSearch/#details/trademarks/014433148|website=EUIPO|publisher=European Union Intellectual Property Office|accessdate=8 February 2017}}</ref> The awards gave special recognition to [[Tony Fernandes]], Group CEO of [[AirAsia]] and Chairman of [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.]], naming him "Brand Builder of the Year" for his outstanding work in building the airline brand.<ref name=SunStar>{{cite news|title=AirAsia Awarded Brand of the Year in Airline Category|url=http://www.sunstar.com.ph/cagayan-de-oro/business/2014/11/04/airasia-awarded-brand-year-airline-category-374601|accessdate=5 December 2014|publisher=Sun Star|date=4 Nov 2014}}</ref>
The second part of the 2014-2015 awards, took place at the [[:fr:Hilton Paris Opéra]] in France on 24 March 2015. The Paris ceremony had an emphasis on food, beverage, luxury, fashion, lifestyle, hospitality, and service brands.<ref name=yahoo-fin-paris/> Fifty brands from 22 countries were awarded at this ceremony.<ref name=FNI-Paris>{{cite news|title=State Bank of India wins ‘Brand of the Year’ Award at The World Branding Awards|url=http://forevernews.in/state-bank-of-india-wins-brand-of-the-year-award-at-the-world-branding-awards/|accessdate=16 May 2015|publisher=Forever News India|date=30 March 2015}}</ref>
In 2015, 118 brands from 30 countries were honoured with an award. The ceremony took place at [[Kensington Palace]] in London. The event was hosted by [[Olivia Wayne]] from [[Sky Sports]].<ref name="reuters15"/>
In 2016, over 120,000 consumers from around the world voted for more than 2,800 brands from 35 countries. 210 brands from 30 countries were declared winners. The ceremony was held again in London's [[Kensington Palace]]. Guests included the United Arab Emirates Ambassador to the United Kingdom, Sulaiman Almazroui,<ref name="GADF16">{{cite news|last1=Noor|first1=Hibah|title=Dubai Duty Free wins Brand of the Year Award|url=http://www.dutyfreemagazine.ca/gulf-africa/industry-news/operator-news/2016/09/28/dubai-duty-free-wins-brand-of-the-year-award/#.WJsGun-8ZEY|accessdate=8 February 2017|publisher=Gulf-Africa Duty Free|date=28 September 2016}}</ref> and the Philippines Ambassador, Evan Garcia.<ref name="FilEmb">{{cite web|title=World Branding Awards recognize Philippine brands|url=http://londonpe.dfa.gov.ph/embassy-news/339-wbf2016|website=Embassy of the Philippines|accessdate=14 February 2017}}</ref> The event was hosted by David Croft.<ref name="TBN-KP16">{{cite news|title=Thai Brands among 210 Winners of the 2016 World Branding Awards at Kensington Palace|url=http://thaibusinessnews.com/readnews.php?id=116|accessdate=8 February 2017|publisher=Thai Business News|date=21 September 2016}}</ref>
In 2017, over 3,000 brands from 35 countries were nominated, and more than 135,000 consumers from around the world participated during the voting period. 245 Brands from 32 countries were awarded.<ref name="wba-2017">{{cite web|title=World Branding Awards - Winners 2017-2018|url=https://awards.brandingforum.org/winners-2017-2018/|publisher=World Branding Forum|accessdate=10 April 2018}}</ref>
In 2018, the Americas Edition of the awards saw over 80,000 consumers vote for more than 1,500 brands from 22 countries from Americas and the Caribbean. There were 81 brands from 16 countries awarded.<ref name="CaribbeanBusiness">{{cite news |title=Banco Popular among 81 winners at World Branding Awards |url=https://caribbeanbusiness.com/banco-popular-among-81-winners-at-world-branding-awards/ |accessdate=3 September 2018 |publisher=Caribbean Business |date=20 July 2018}}</ref>
The awards trophy is made in [[England]],<ref name=efx>{{cite web|title=EFX Acclaimed for World Branding Awards|url=http://www.awardefx.co.uk/uploads/email/efxnewsnovember14/newsnovember14.html|website=Award EFX|publisher=EFX|accessdate=21 February 2015}}</ref> and is on display at the [[Museum of Brands, Packaging & Advertising]] in London.<ref name=enquirer-herald>{{cite news|title=World Branding Forum Sponsors Museum of Brands, Packaging and Advertising Education Project|url=http://www.heraldonline.com/2015/02/09/6781165_world-branding-forum-sponsors.html?rh=1|accessdate=21 February 2015|publisher=Enquirer Herald|date=9 Feb 2015}}</ref> In 2016, a newly designed [[24 karat]] gold plated trophy was introduced for all winners. This new design is a solid trophy which highlights the "Brand of the Year" registered trademark logo.<ref name="AppleWorld-16">{{cite news|last1=Sellers|first1=Dennis|title=Apple among 210 winners of the 2016 World Branding Awards|url=https://www.appleworld.today/blog/2016/9/21/apple-among-210-winners-of-the-2016-world-branding-awards|accessdate=8 February 2017|publisher=Apple World Today|date=21 September 2016}}</ref>

Rosa Dalmau Vilá }} '''Manuel Salvat Dalmau''' (October 4, 1925 in [[Barcelona]], [[Catalunya]] – September 11, 2012) was a [[Spanish people|Spanish]] [[publisher]]. From a family of important publishing tradition, he directed the [[Editorial Salvat]] and served as President of the [[International Publishers Association]]. == Private life== Son of [[Santiago Salvat Espasa]] and Rosa Dalmau Vilá and grandson of [[Manuel Salvat Xivixell]]. He studied in the [[Colegio Sant Ignasi - Sarrià]] of [[Barcelona]] where he was acknowledged as a brilliant student. Graduated with a degree in [[Law]] from the [[Universidad de Barcelona]] and a degree in [[Business Management]] from [[IESE Business School]]. He was married to Blanca Vilá Reyes and had six sons and one daughter. He was also the joint co-founder of the [[Escuela Patmos]] of [[Barcelona]] in 1958 with five other couples (the Amor Sagués, Tornos, Poblet, Puche, Comas, and Latorre,) Priest [[Joan Alemany I Esteve]], and writer and pedagogue [[Emili Teixidor]].Escola Patmos i Emili Teixidor (in Catalan), {{cite web |url=http://www.enciclopedia.cat/fitxa_v2.jsp?NDCHEC=0065418 |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2012-08-15 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20101119010201/http://www.enciclopedia.cat/fitxa_v2.jsp?NDCHEC=0065418 |archivedate=2010-11-19 |df= }}. == Professional life == === Editorial Salvat === Manuel Salvat Dalmau joined the family business, Salvat Editores S.A. (the publishing company known as [[Editorial Salvat]]), in the late 1940s, becoming manager, together with his brothers Santiago and Juan. The company was then leading the Spanish American market in [[dictionaries]] and medical works. From that position it developed an important change in the Spanish publishing sector by intensifying the sales of [[encyclopedias]] through fascicles. The Salvat Group associated with the Boroli family, owner of ''De Agostini'',[http://www.enciclopedia.cat/fitxa_v2.jsp?NDCHEC=0058370 La Editorial Salvat] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20121209063740/http://www.enciclopedia.cat/fitxa_v2.jsp?NDCHEC=0058370 |date=2012-12-09 }}, en la [[Enciclopedia Catalana]] (in Catalan). which had initiated the sale through fascicles in [[Italy]]. For that purpose, they created a new distribution company, ''Marco Ibérica S.A.'' (MIDESA), reaching 22 thousand kiosks weekly, resulting in unprecedented success in 1965 with the ''Enciclopedia Monitor'',Editorial Salvat, [http://www.salvat.com/paginas/informacion_corporativa.asp Información corporativa] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120922030007/http://www.salvat.com/paginas/informacion_corporativa.asp |date=2012-09-22 }} (in Spanish). of which more than 300 thousand complete collections were sold. Other outstanding achievements while he directed the publishing company were: [[Félix Rodríguez de la Fuente]]'s ''Enciclopedia de la Fauna'', with over 200 thousand sold copies and the paperback collection ''RTV'', of which the first edition in 1969 sold over a million copies. The [[Editorial Salvat]] created over 50 [[encyclopedias]], being also pioneer in incorporating CDs and cassettes in diverse works. In [[France]] it obtained a very important market quota. In [[Latin America]] it specialized in the sales of [[encyclopedias]] with notable success. Manuel Salvat's trajectory led him to become President of the [[International Publishers Association]] (IPA) from 1980 to 1984.Manuel Salvat elegido Presidente de la UIE, [http://hemeroteca.lavanguardia.com/preview/1979/10/21/pagina-44/33440753/pdf.html?search=manuel%20salvat] (in Spanish). In the late 1980s the Salvat Group was purchased by the French multinational [[Hachette (publisher)|Hachette]]. === Matesa Affair === Manuel Salvat Dalmau was the second-most [[shareholder]] of one of his family-in-law's companies, ''Matesa'' (Maquinaria Textil del Norte de España S.A.). When the scandal broke out in 1969, he was required to pay the guaranteed part of the official [[export]] [[credit]]s that the company had arranged between 1963 and 1969. His brother-in-law and major shareholder (Juan Vilá Reyes) was condemned of swindling as he benefited from loans and export tax exemptions by falsifying sales contracts. The [[conviction]] was upheld by the Spanish [[Supreme court|Supreme Court]] in 1976.Ratificación Sentencia Matesa, [http://hemeroteca.lavanguardia.com/preview/1976/02/12/pagina-10/33780033/pdf.html] (in Spanish). Manuel Salvat had secured these [[credit]]s without having knowledge of doing so because his brother-in-law had signed them, using his name fraudulently. Even though he was not charged in the ''Matesa Affair'', Manuel Salvat took care of the [[debt]] with the ''Liquidation of Export Credit Commission'' (Spanish [[Minister of Economy and Finance (Spain)|Ministry of Finance]],Matesa Case, [http://elpais.com/diario/1983/01/19/economia/411778806_850215.html](in Spanish).) which allowed him to carry on with his [[publishing]] tasks. == References == {{Reflist}} == Bibliography == *Castellano, Philippe (2010). ''Dos editores de Barcelona por América Latina.'' Editorial Iberoamericana, Madrid. *Castellano, Philippe (2000). ''La Enciclopedia Espasa.'' Editorial Espasa, Madrid. *Cátedra, Pedro y colaboradores (2004). ''La memoria de los libros: Estudios sobre la historia del escrito y de la lectura en Europa y América.'' Instituto de Historia del Libro y de la Lectura, Madrid: 679-700. *Jardí, Enric (1977). ''1.000 Familias Catalanas.'' Editorial Dopesa, Barcelona. *Ghay, O.P. y Kumar, Narrendra (1984). ''International Publishing Today.'' {{Infobox person | name = Michael ByungJu Kim | image = | caption = | birth_date = | birth_place = [[Seoul]], [[South Korea]] | death_date = | death_place = | occupation = Founder, MBK Partners | education = [[Haverford College]]
MBA, [[Harvard Business School]] | spouse = Park Kyung-ah | children = | salary = | networth = US$1 billion (January 2018){{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/profile/michael-kim/|title=Michael Kim|publisher=}} | website = | module = {{Infobox Korean name|child=yes | hangul = 김병주 | hanja = 金秉奏{{cite news|url=http://www.munhwa.com/news/view.html?no=1999052910000701|title=美금융업체 칼라일그룹 한국에 10억弗투자 추진|newspaper=[[Munhwa Ilbo]]|date=29 May 1999|access-date=17 September 2018}} | rr = Gim Byeongju | mr = Kim Pyŏngju}} }} '''Michael ByungJu Kim''' is a South Korean [[billionaire]] businessman.{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/lists/2007/54/richlist07_Daniel-DAniello_Y81T.html|title=#165 Daniel D'Aniello - Forbes.com|website=www.forbes.com}}{{cite web|url=http://cached.newslookup.com/cached.php?ref_id=20&siteid=949&id=11430496&t=1423087260|title=Korea’s Michael Kim Leads Buyout Surge as Foreign Firms Return|website=Bloomberg.com}} He is the cofounder and partner of MBK Partners, a [[private equity]] firm headquartered in [[Seoul]], South Korea. He is known as the "Godfather of Asian private equity".{{cite web|url=http://www.financeasia.com/News/428424,michael-kim-godfather-of-asian-private-equity.aspx|title=Michael Kim: Godfather of Asian private equity|first=Haymarket Media|last=Limited|publisher=}} ==Biography== ===Early life and career=== Kim received an MBA from the [[Harvard Business School]] in 1990 and received a [[Fulbright Scholarship]] afterwards.{{cite web|url=https://www.mbkpartnerslp.com/michael-byungju-kim/|title=MBK PARTNERS|date=10 July 2015|publisher=}} Kim begin his career as an [[mergers and acquisitions]] banker at [[Goldman Sachs]] after graduating from Harvard. In 1995, he joined [[Salomon Smith Barney]], where he became Managing Director and COO of Asia-Pacific Investment Banking. He later joined the [[Carlyle Group]] as a president of Carlyle Asia until 2005. Kim left Carlyle to found MBK Partners in 2005, which has since grown to over $14.6 billion in assets under management, raising $4.1 billion in the last fund becoming the largest independent [[private equity]] fund in Asia.{{cite web|url=https://www.dealstreetasia.com/stories/south-koreas-mbk-partners-raises-4-1b-for-its-fourth-fund-60141/|title=South Korea's MBK Partners raises $4.1b for its fourth fund|website=www.dealstreetasia.com}} Kim has been notable for breaking several records in the South Korean market. His takeover of [[ING]] Korea and listing on the market, was the first time a private-equity owned company listed on exchanges in South Korea.{{cite web|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/southkorea-ing-life-insurance-ipo/update-1-ing-life-insurance-korea-raises-974-mln-after-pricing-ipo-near-lower-end-of-range-idUSL4N1HW2K7|title=UPDATE 1-ING Life Insurance Korea raises $974 mln after pricing IPO...|date=24 April 2017|publisher=|via=Reuters}} His takeover of [[Tesco]] subsidiary [[Homeplus]] was the largest private equity deal in South Korea's history. Kim is or has been on the boards of [[Haverford College]], KorAm Bank, China Network Systems, Yayoi, C&M, Tasaki, [[Universal Studios]] Japan, Coway, [[ING]] Life Korea, [[Homeplus]], and the [[Metropolitan Museum]].{{cite web|url=https://www.metmuseum.org/press/news/2017/michael-byungju-kim|title=Michael ByungJu Kim Elected Metropolitan Museum Trustee - The Metropolitan Museum of Art|website=www.metmuseum.org}} Kim is listed as one of 73 trustees of the Carnegie Hall Corporation.{{cite web |title=Board of Trustees |url=https://www.carnegiehall.org/About/Leadership-and-Staff/Board-of-Trustees |website=www.carnegiehall.org |language=en}} In 2015 Kim was ranked #42 on [[50 Most Influential (Bloomberg Markets ranking)|Bloomberg's 50 Most Influential]].{{cite web |title=50 Most Influential - #42 |url=https://www.bloomberg.com/features/2015-markets-most-influential/#kim |website=www.bloomberg.com}} ===Philanthropy=== In 2010, Kim pledged $7.5 million toward the construction of a new dormitory at [[Haverford College]].{{cite web|url=https://www.haverford.edu/college-communications/news/haverford-build-another-new-dorm|title=Haverford To Build Another New Dorm|publisher=}} ===Personal life=== Kim is married to Park Kyung-ah, the daughter of the late South Korean [[Prime Minister]] [[Park Tae-joon]] under President [[Park Chung-hee]]. Park also founded [[POSCO]], the largest steel company in South Korea. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kim, Michael}} [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:South Korean company founders]] [[Category:Haverford College alumni]] [[Category:Harvard Business School alumni]] [[Category:People from Seoul]] [[Category:South Korean businesspeople]] [[Category:South Korean billionaires]]
